statement:
[**Theorem -**]{} Every (or ) hyperreal number $x \in {}^*\mathbb{R}$
admits a unique of the form $$x = a + \epsilon$$ where
$a \in \mathbb{R}$ and $\epsilon$ is infinitesimal.

[**Remark :**]{} This theorem just says that every finite hyperreal
number has a real part and an infinitesimal part (just like real and
imaginary parts in complex numbers).
